vision.notes: Likely present, given their predatory lifestyle and presence in deep-sea habitats where some light may penetrate. No specific details are provided in the context, but vision is a common sense in sharks.

electroreception.notes: Sharks possess ampullae of Lorenzini for detecting electrical fields. This is a common trait among sharks and likely present in this family. Important for prey detection in deep-sea environments.

mechanoreception.notes: Lateral line system detects vibrations and pressure changes in the water. This is a common sensory system in sharks.

chemoreception.notes: Olfactory senses are used to detect chemical cues in the water. Sharks have well-developed olfactory systems for locating prey and navigating.
